message_1: Suppose you are given the following message that has been encrypted using a substitution cipher: "Htfxm nyby npj xtwtbm tkf hytwz". If "a" has been replaced with "h", "b" with "t", and so on, can you figure out what the original message was?
message_2:
Yes, I can figure out the original message. Using the given substitution pattern, we can decrypt the message as follows:

H -> G (a -> h, so h -> a + 7 -> g)
t -> o (b -> t, so t -> b + 7 -> o)
f -> r (c -> f, so f -> c + 7 -> r)
x -> e (d -> x, so x -> d + 7 -> e)
m -> a (e -> m, so m -> e + 7 -> a)

Following this pattern, we can decrypt the entire message:

Htfxm nyby npj xtwtbm tkf hytwz
Great work on secret code for giants

So, the original message was: "Great work on secret code for giants".
